tool.name: SiriusAdapter
tool.description: Tool for metabolite identification using single and tandem mass spectrometry
tool.command:
SiriusAdapter
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out_sirius: -out_sirius $param_out_sirius #end if #if $param_out_fingerid: -out_fingerid $param_out_fingerid #end if #if $param_profile: -profile #if " " in str($param_profile): "$param_profile" #else $param_profile #end if #end if #if $param_candidates: -candidates $param_candidates #end if #if $param_database: -database #if " " in str($param_database): "$param_database" #else $param_database #end if #end if #if $param_noise: -noise $param_noise #end if #if $param_ppm_max: -ppm_max $param_ppm_max #end if #if $param_isotope: -isotope #if " " in str($param_isotope): "$param_isotope" #else $param_isotope #end if #end if #if $param_elements: -elements "$param_elements" #end if #if $param_number: -number $param_number #end if #if $param_auto_charge: -auto_charge #end if #if $param_iontree: -iontree #end if #if $param_no_recalibration: -no_recalibration #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #end if

param.name: param_candidates
param.label: The number of candidates in the output

param.name: param_isotope
param.label: how to handle isotope pattern data
param.help: (-isotope) Use 'score' to use them for ranking or 'filter' if you just want to remove candidates with bad isotope pattern. With 'both' you can use isotopes for filtering and scoring (default). Use 'omit' to ignore isotope pattern

param.name: param_elements
param.label: The allowed elements
param.help: (-elements) Write CHNOPSCl to allow the elements C, H, N, O, P, S and Cl. Add numbers in brackets to restrict the maximal allowed occurence of these elements: CHNOP[5]S[8]Cl[1]. By default CHNOP[5]S is used

param.name: param_number
param.label: The number of compounds used in the output

param.name: param_auto_charge
param.label: Use this option if the charge of your compounds is unknown and you do not want to assume [M+H]+ as default
param.help: (-auto_charge) With the auto charge option SIRIUS will not care about charges and allow arbitrary adducts for the precursor peak

param.name: param_iontree
param.label: Print molecular formulas and node labels with the ion formula instead of the neutral formula

param.name: param_no_recalibration
param.label: If this option is set, SIRIUS will not recalibrate the spectrum during the analysis

tool.help:
Tool for metabolite identification using single and tandem mass spectrometry
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/UTILS_SiriusAdapter.html
